message:
Shibir stages demos countrywide on 1st day of ceaseless 48-hour shutdown:

The daydream about hanging on power through a sham election won’t come true- Chhatrashibir


Bangladesh Islami Chhatrashibir brought out demos and processions across the country including the capital city on 1st day of long 48-hour hartal called by the grand 18-party alliance. Cops attacked on peaceful processions in many places of the country. About 25 Shibir men got injured due to police-y attacks and 38 more have been nabbed unjustly by the policemen.

Shibir leaders said while carrying out today’s shutdown, “Bangladesh fell into very deep crisis due to illegal power-greed of Awami League. Awami League tarnished the image of the country to the world by using the state-oriented institutions as well as departments for the sake of its party purpose. Bangladesh has been listed among top ten most vulnerable territories of the world. The Awami government has detached the country from the rest of the world by designing a one-sided and one-party election. But, the patriotic student segment won’t allow such devastating conspiracy to be successful. The government’s daydream about holding on power through a farcical election won’t come true.”
